title: ORGANIC CHEMISTRY I
description:
Cat. I
 
A systematic survey of the major reaction types and functional groups in organic
chemistry. The course will provide a representative collection of characteristic
 reactions and transformations of a variety of types of organic molecules. Most of 
the examples will be drawn from aliphatic chemistry. Some theoretical models 
will be introduced with a view toward establishing a general overview of the
 material.
 

The course is intended for chemists, chemical engineers, pre-medical students 
and all those interested in the biosciences. A familiarity with the material
 presented in the general chemistry courses is assumed.
